issues.description: The UML in the problem statement and the template implementation declare singFarmSongVerse as a private Farm method, but the solution repository implements it as protected (solution: protected void singFarmSongVerse(Animal)). This is a visibility mismatch between the specification/template and the reference solution. While this does not change behavior, it is a structural inconsistency that could confuse students about the intended visibility (and could matter if tests or extensions rely on the method being private).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the visibility consistent. Either change the solution method to private (private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal)) to match the UML/template, or update the UML/template to indicate protected visibility. Prefer making the solution method private if the verse method is intended as an internal helper; otherwise update the UML and template comments to show protected.
